pullRequest.title: [Fundamental] Sub-level programming through Subnet and Route Mgr
pullRequest.bodyText:
The implementation of Sub-level programming mainly includes the following features:

Update of route rule, including VPC route rule and this Subnet route rule;
Integration of route manager and PM
Integration of route manager and DPM
Fixed issues related to gateway IP update (tracked by Issue #446)


Test scenarios:

Create a VPC (success)
Create a Subnet. Subnet get gateway port from PM (comment the step of sending info to DPM)  (success)
Create a Port (success)
SM Path: Create/Update/Delete subnet routing rule ->  Create/Update/Delete subnet routetable in RM. (success)
RM Path - For Neutron Router，Add/Remove extra routes -> Update/Delete HostRoute in SubnetEntity in SM (success)
RM Path -  For VPC router， Create/Update/Delete subnet routetable -> Create/Update/Delete HostRoute in SubnetEntity in SM (pending)

nodes.bodyText:
The api for creating subnet route table for Neutron should be like this:
/project/{projectid}/subnets/{subnetid}/routetable

Please refer to https://github.com/futurewei-cloud/alcor/blob/master/docs/modules/ROOT/pages/mgmt_services/route_manager.adoc#subnet_add_neutron_routetable
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -293,6 +293,43 @@ public RouteTableWebJson getOrCreateSubnetRouteTable(@PathVariable String projec
         return new RouteTableWebJson(routeTable);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Create neutron subnet routeTable
+     * @param projectid
+     * @param subnetid
+     * @param resource
+     * @return
+     * @throws Exception
+     */
+    @RequestMapping(
+            method = POST,
+            value = {"/project/{projectid}/subnets/{subnetid}/neutron-routetable"})

nodes.bodyText: Should we consider to make updateRoutingRule more general so that both Neutron and VPC scenarios can utilize this internal function?
We need to call updateRoutingRule from here or from createNeutronSubnetRouteTable to send InternalRouterInfo to DPM or PM.
After this, we should call updateRoutingRule
wrong URL. It should be /project/{projectid}/subnets/{subnetid}/routetable
deleteSubnetRoutingRuleInRM, updateSubnetRoutingRuleInRM, and createSubnetRoutingRuleInRM three functions are doing pretty similar task, should we consider to consolidate them into one function?
Should we catch exception here instead of just return nothing when the subnet is not exist?
If hostRoutes == null, we should replace hostRoutes with routingRules, right?
It's not allow destination or operationType equal to null in the InternalRouterInfo. Should we catch this exception instead of just continue?
Again, it not allow subnetDestination = null.
Do you think it costs too much to iterate all routes for each UPDATE route?
same comment above, can we lookup hostRoute by destination?
Chane RoutesToNeutronRouterRequestObject routerObject to a more generic routes object like we discuss before.

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/futurewei-cloud/alcor into new_master

nodes.bodyText: I think we don't need this part if we use routetable id or owner id to search for the routetable.
The variable router here is a bit of confusion, it means routes right?

Did we change ports field name in Router entity to gateway_ports?
If we did, router.getPorts() may be get trouble.
It should have only one InternalSubnetRoutingTable, not a List.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,55 @@

+package com.futurewei.alcor.web.entity.route;
+
+import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
+import com.futurewei.alcor.web.entity.subnet.HostRoute;
+import lombok.Data;
+
+import java.util.List;
+
+@Data
+public class UpdateRoutingRuleResponse {
+
+    @JsonProperty("internalRouterInfo")
+    private List<InternalSubnetRoutingTable> internalSubnetRoutingTables;
+

nodes.bodyText: this.neutronRouterService.updateRoutingRule(subnetId, newRoutes, true) is only process one subnet, so it should only return a single InternalSubnetRoutingTable inside of UpdateRoutingRuleResponse.
We don't need todo for L3-neighbors here, you can remove it.
same comment as in the addRoutesToNeutronRouter
How do we convert these priority strings to integer?
For VPC, it should be target instead of nexthop.
Not quite understand why you need to iterate each input route and convert it into newRouteEntry?

So, we use this.neutronRouterService.updateRoutingRule for both Neutron and VPC scenarios?
It should only return one single InternalSubnetRoutingTable.
this.neutronRouterService.updateRoutingRule should only return one single InternalSubnetRoutingTable.
For Neutron's case, I think we don't need to return new HostRoute back to SM, since SM is already update its HostRoute when the subnet is created in SM.
This API is for VPC scenario, we should set it's Target too.

We may think about how user update subnet's host route in the VPC scenario.
If we let user update subnet's route table through RM's API, then we need to update subnet's hostroute in SM.
Otherwise, if we let user update that through SM, SM already has the new host route information, then there is no need to send the new host route back to SM from here.
boolean isNeutronOrVPCLevelRoutingRule is a boolean, so it's better rename the variable to isDefaultRoutingRules.
It's better name the function removeRoutesFromNeutronRouter.
Do we need put these operations here? or move them into else part below if the if part doesn't need them.
default routing rules don't need update back to subnet's host route or routing table.
You need to move existRoutesMap.remove(newNetworkIP) out of this else part, the if (isNeutronOrVPCLevelRoutingRule) part also need to remove the existing routing rule from the map.

If owner == null that's mean we cannot find routetable right?
then why we still need to set owner to internalSubnetRoutingTable?

Is that possible for route == null, that's mean existing route doesn't exist?
If it's null, how can you getId() from a null?

Why not just set these properties based on the operation type?
if (operationType == CREATE), the routing rule's properties use new route's properties.
if (operationType == UPDATE), only nexthop use new route's property, others use existing route's properties.
if (operationType == DELETE), use existing route's properties.
if (newRouteRequest.getTarget() != null) we need to translate target label name to a real nexthop ip address and next_hop_mac in the 'routingRuleExtraInfo' entity by calling Gateway Manager.
priority property is an integer, how do you plan to convert these string to integer?

Does PM has bulk create/query by a list of IP addresses?
If there is, we can just make an API call and do a batch process.
What if update failed?
What if delete failed?
we don't use default_routing_table anymore.
Add comments.
@chenpiaoping Could you pls review this change? I raised a question on Slack channel regarding why we need to reevaluate subnet and route after allocating IP address.
Please remove and cleanup the commented codes. @kevin-zhonghao
Same here.
For the new configurations in RM and SM, don't forget to add them in K8s yaml file :-)
